page.title: 11THE BLACKWOOD AND THE BOGS.
page.content: Hetton Houses Wood, also known as the Black Wood has several varieties of deciduous trees : silver birch, oak, ash, some sycamores, guelder rose and lots of hawthorn trees. We ate some of the small green hawthorn leaves which are nick-named bread and cheese. It is dark in the middle of the wood, the ground is covered with dead leaves, there are lots of bluebells. {Broomhill / The Bogs.}This is an area of{wetland}to the west of Broomhill. There is a slow-moving{stream}where frogs and newts breed, marsh marigolds, celandines, milk-maids, and water plankton are common. We saw many common horsetails and marsh horsetails, which are poisonous to cattle. Giant ones grew millions of years ago here and are now part of the coal_seams.
